questions.question: Workplace Incidents are accidents and conflicts which can involve...

choices.answer: internal stakeholders such as employees and managers
external stakeholders such as customers and suppliers
both internal and external stakeholders

questions.question: A workplace incident has the potential to put at risk the safety of...

choices.answer: employees of a business or prevent the business from running
customers of the business or prevent the business running
stakeholders or prevent the business from running normally

questions.question: Which of the following is related to a workplace incident

choices.answer: worker conflict, gas, power, water failure
Equipment and technology failure
H&S accidents, contact with dangerous goods, fire/explosion
all are correct

questions.question: Businesses, small and large are required to comply with H&S regulations...

choices.answer: or be unable to continue to operate
or otherwise will result in fewer customers
or face harsh penalties or be liable for prosecution

questions.question: H&S laws are in place to minimise potential harm (injury or death) to

choices.answer: students, parents and the community
customers, staff, visitors to the organisation
both internal and external stakeholders

questions.question: Failure to follow H&S laws can result in staff, customers or visitor injury,

choices.answer: leading to the business being prosecuted for negligence
leading to more staff requiring time off work
leading to higher medical treatment costs for those affected

questions.question: Injury to staff due to poor H&S laws will result in staff, requiring time of work,

choices.answer: meaning lower production and costs to replace absent worker
medical treatment costs to get the employee back at work
and apologising to the worker involved in the accident

questions.question: Applying H&S measures can minimise worker & stakeholder incidents as it

choices.answer: identifies potential hazards and isolates them
All are correct
allows employee input to create a safe working environment
requires protective/high visibility clothing/equipment

questions.question: Workplace conflict is OFTEN the result of

choices.answer: who got a promotion
who received a pay rise
a personality conflict
all are true

questions.question: A personality conflict is usually occurs when...

choices.answer: different people don't see eye-to-eye
different people hold different ideas, values or beliefs
different people believe in a different religion

questions.question: One cause of a personality conflict could...

choices.answer: be between an employee and a supplier
be between two different departments
be between a manager and an employee
be between a business owner and local community stakeholder

questions.question: The short-term impacts or consequences of workplace conflict can result in...

choices.answer: Arguments & disagreements between various stakeholders
Tasks going uncompleted-upsetting customer satisfaction
Lower levels of productivity = higher costs
Lengthy negotiating/decision making

questions.question: The long-term effects of workplace conflict can result in

choices.answer: loss of customer/supplier contracts- costly
Damage to brand and reputation of business
damage to relationships both internally and externally
Higher staff turnover

questions.question: When conflict between employees becomes a concern, the manager should...

choices.answer: identify causes, arrange meeting, agree on solutions
and if necessary dismiss workers responsible
identify causes, arrange meeting, agree on solutions
and if necessary separate workers' locations & shifts

questions.question: Independent, internal mediation led by the Department of Labour should be used for solving

choices.answer: employee conflicts to reach a a suitable agreement
employee-employer conflict to reach a suitable agreement
employee-supplier conflict to reach a suitable agreement
business owner-community stakeholder conflict

questions.question: Eliminating reputation damage by restricting communication with stakeholders to managers is...

choices.answer: how conflict with an internal stakeholder should be solved
how conflict with an external stakeholder should be solved

questions.question: When conflict is not resolved, the following can occur...

choices.answer: more employees become affected impacting on task completion
profits are likely to shrink
staff are likely to spread this news to potential employees

questions.question: When conflict is not resolved, the following can occur...

choices.answer: Customer satisfaction in the products they purchase
More employees wishing to work at the business
Customer dissatisfaction, causing them to seek alternatives
none of the above

questions.question: When conflict is not resolved the following can occur,

choices.answer: negative reviews on social media, visible to other customers
both of the answers are correct!
customer dissatisfaction leading to negative publicity
